Package io.github.thecsdev.tcdcommons.api.client.gui.panel.menu.item

Interface IMenuPanelItem

All Superinterfaces:
IEnableStateProvider, TParentElement
All Known Implementing Classes:
TMenuPanelButton, TMenuPanelSeparator
public interface IMenuPanelItem extends TParentElement
Represents a GUI element on a TMenuPanel.

  • Field Summary

    Fields inherited from interface io.github.thecsdev.tcdcommons.api.client.gui.TParentElement

    MAX_CHILD_NESTING_DEPTH

    Method

    void
    pack()
    This method sets the size of this IMenuPanelItem to its minimum possible size by calling TElement.setSize(int, int).
    default void
    realignParentMenuChildren()
    If TParentElement.getParent() is a TMenuPanel, calls TMenuPanel.realignChildren() on it.

    Methods inherited from interface io.github.thecsdev.tcdcommons.api.client.gui.TParentElement

    addChild, addChild, clearChildren, findChild, findLastChild, findParent, findParentTElement, forEachChild, getChildren, getEnabled, getEndX, getEndY, getHeight, getParent, getWidth, getX, getY, getZIndex, input, input, isEnabled, removeChild, removeChild, render

  • Method Details

    • pack

      void pack()
      This method sets the size of this IMenuPanelItem to its minimum possible size by calling TElement.setSize(int, int). It's akin to the packing of a component in Swing, where the component is resized to the smallest possible size that accommodates its contents.

      This allows the parent TMenuPanel to properly control this element's size when re-aligning its children.

      See Also:
      • realignParentMenuChildren()
      • TMenuPanel.realignChildren()

    • realignParentMenuChildren

      default void realignParentMenuChildren()
      If TParentElement.getParent() is a TMenuPanel, calls TMenuPanel.realignChildren() on it.
